Name: Fragment of an Anthropoid Coffin
Description: Despite its state of preservation, this fragment of an anthropoid, or mummy-shaped, coffin depicts the face of a man in the style of art practiced at the time of Amenhotep the Third. It shows the pouting mouth with fleshy lips flanked by two depressions and the softly rounded chin and wide-based nose. A ceremonial beard is attached to the chin.
